title: Buddha in the hearts of Vietnamese people
text: ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ø‡§§‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ó‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§è‡§ï ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§§ ‡§¨‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß ‡§è‡§ï ‡§≠‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•Å ‡§•‡§æ ‡§ú‡•ã 4 ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§§‡§ï ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•á ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ø‡§§‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§®‡§Ç‡§ó‡•á ‡§™‡•à‡§∞ ‡§ò‡•Ç‡§Æ‡§§‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡•§ ‡§ï‡•ã‡§£ ‡§π‡•à ‡§µ‡•ã‡§π? Êúâ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂíåÂ∞öËµ§ËÑöËµ∞ÈÅçË∂äÂçóÂõõÂπ¥„ÄÇÁé∞Âú®ÂèóÂà∞ÂæàÂ§ö‰∫∫ÁöÑÂ∞äÈáç„ÄÇ ÈÇ£ÊòØË∞ÅÔºü Chanel: https://youtube.com/@minhtuemonk-vietnambuddh-rv7fr?si=_F6zr_9MddE5RVX- Buddha in the hearts of Vietnamese people Ascetic monks in Vietnam walked across the country for 6 years. From 2019 to 2024: The first 2 years of Master Thich Minh Tue's practice at the temple and in seclusion in the cave. For 4 years, I have been walking along the national highway from the North to the South, and vice versa from the South to the North. He traveled on foot through all provinces and cities in Vietnam. Food & Eating: During the trip: only accept vegetarian food once a day and eat before noon. His clothes were made of patchwork fabric. Master Sleep sits next to him under the corner of a tree or sleeps in the cemetery and only sleeps sitting, not sleeping lying down. By this year, this monk became widely known through Youtube and tickok channels. And there are also many people who have shaved their hair like Master Minh Tue and have followed him as an 'escort'. Local people welcomed them on both sides of the road in large numbers, obstructing traffic and causing the traffic police to get involved. What will the Master's upcoming journey be like?

author: KTVU staff
title: Storm surge, high surf forces Santa Cruz beaches to close, Stinson Beach evacuation
text:
Marin County sees evacuation orders lifted in some areas In Marin County, evacuation orders have been canceled for areas around Stinson Beach. Earlier Thursday, some communities near the beach were told to be ready to go due to high surf and storm surge.
SANTA CRUZ, Calif. - The Bay Area's beach towns got hammered on Thursday as high surf and storm surges ravaged the coastline.
Around Santa Cruz, seaside streets were littered with debris, soaked with flooding, and battered by big waves. The city closed the Santa Cruz Wharf, Main Beach and Cowell Beach because of the massive waves and resulting damage.
At Rio Del Mar State Beach in Santa Cruz, logs littered the sandy coast and onlookers sat on perches witnessing Mother Nature in action.
In addition, West Cliff in Santa Cruz was also closed between Columbia and David Way. The iconic road is still being repaired from last year's storms.
Meanwhile, in Pacifica, a pair of crab fishers arrived at Linda Mar Beach and then turned around to go home.
"Apparently, that's not going to happen," Paul Gonzales said. "But the pier's closed. These waves are outrageous."
Steve Ramirez sighed and said: "We're just going to pack up."
High surf warnings and advisories are in effect along the entire California coast as waves are expected to break up to 40 feet high. As of Thursday afternoon, reports from the Bay Area's coastal buoys were showing waves just under 30 feet off both the Sonoma County coast and Monterey Bay.
Huge low-pressure systems in the Pacific Ocean are pushing large groups of waves toward the California coast.
The National Weather Service reported that its buoy off Bodega Bay recorded waves up to 28 feet on Thursday morning, closing in on the previous record of 31 feet seen during January storms at the beginning of the year.
Evacuation warnings lifted after high surf and flooding shut down Santa Cruz, coastal areas Around Santa Cruz, seaside streets were littered with debris, soaked with flooding, and battered by big waves. The city closed the Santa Cruz Wharf, Main Beach and Cowell Beach because of the massive waves and resulting damage.
At Rio Del Mar Beach, the waves crashed over walls, flooding streets, and depositing massive trees and driftwood ashore.
"The trees act like battering rams against the houses and the garage doors that are along the street here," says resident, Steve Benedetti.
Residents in Santa Cruz County know the danger all too well. So do the authorities. But they worried about the tourists.
"We do have visitors from out of town that may not have been expecting this kind of tidal surge during their visit. So we did have deputies out here very early going door to door explaining to people hey this is coming," says Ashley Keehn, public information officer with the Santa Cruz County Sheriff's Office.
Early in the morning, the Stinson Beach Fire Department issued an evacuation order for several neighborhoods because of high surf as the winds and waves were enormous, telling people they could find a temporary safe harbor at the Stinson Beach Community Center.
The order was issued just before 10 a.m., and people were sent to the Stinson Beach Community Center for refuge. Residents in the Calles Pinos, Pradero, Sierra, Onda Resaca, Ribera, Embarcadero, and sections of Calle Del Arroyo weren‚Äôt told to return to their homes until early in the afternoon.
Drone pilot David Golubev shot video of the swell hitting the beach around 11 a.m. and getting dangerously close to houses and buildings along the shoreline.
"Definitely the highest tide I‚Äôve seen so far. You could see it on the beach. It came up all the way to the top," Golubev said. "I saw it was high tide, and I heard the water so I came out to see how far the water came up."
Officials said the waves reached 10 feet, more than the National Weather Service predicted.
The evacuation order was lifted in the early afternoon when the tide receded.
Stinson Beach Fire Chief Jesse Peri said crews are still assessing the damage in the area and at last count Thursday afternoon one person has minor injuries and a handful of homes suffered minor structural damage.
"The community is really resilient, so they came together to help sandbag and help each other out," said Peri, who reiterated that people should continue to stay away from the water.
Further south in San Francisco, strong swells crashed against San Francisco's Fort Point.
Image 1 of 10 ‚ñº Rio Del Mar Esplanade is currently flooded in Santa Cruz on Dec. 28, 2023. Photo: Santa Cruz County

author: Craig George
title: Longford Truck Run supports RFDS with 3000 people raising $35,000
text:
Did the sound of truck horns wake you up on Sunday, March 2?
Two hundred semi-trucks made their way through Launceston to the Longford Showgrounds for the 42nd Longford Truck Run.
The well-loved event attracted 3000 people on Sunday, March 2, to raise money for the Royal Flying Doctor Service (RFDS).
In 2023, the event raised $35,000 for the RFDS - and this year, the team wanted to raise even more.
Coffee and food vans, a barbecue lunch, face painting, fire trucks and an RFDS simulator were just a few things on offer at the event - and entry was a good coin donation.
One of the event organisers, Ros Bonner, said she was passionate about raising money for the RFDS.
"You never know when you'll need the RFDS. They have saved lots of lives," she said.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : la Russie doit "ressentir" les effets de "la guerre", estime Volodymyr Zelensky apr√®s l'incursion de son arm√©e dans la r√©gion de Koursk
text: Le pr√©sident ukrainien a estim√©, jeudi 8 ao√ªt, que la Russie, cible d'une incursion majeure des troupes ukrainiennes dans la r√©gion frontali√®re de Koursk pour le troisi√®me jour cons√©cutif, devait √† son tour "ressentir" les cons√©quences de l'invasion qu'elle a lanc√©e en f√©vrier 2022. Plus de mille soldats ukrainiens avec une dizaine de chars et une vingtaine de blind√©s ont p√©n√©tr√© mardi dans cette r√©gion, selon l'√©tat-major russe, qui a dit tout faire pour les repousser de l'autre c√¥t√© de la fronti√®re.Ce contingent semble toutefois avoir gagn√© du terrain en s'emparant de plusieurs kilom√®tres carr√©s en prenant les forces russes au d√©pourvu, bien que Kiev ait gard√© un silence quasi total sur l'op√©ration. "La Russie a apport√© la guerre √† notre pays et devrait en ressentir" les effets, a lanc√© Volodymyr Zelensky dans son allocution du soir, sans pour autant mentionner directement cette incursion.Today, I held an extended meeting with our foreign affairs team regarding our interaction with NATO ‚Äì both with the Alliance as a whole and specifically with our neighboring NATO member countries.It is evident that together we can add more security and stability to our region‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com\/M27X2S019m‚Äî Volodymyr Zelenskyy \/ –í–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ó–µ–ª–µ–Ω—Å—å–∫–∏–π (@ZelenskyyUa) August 8, 2024Dans un message publi√© sur X, son conseiller Mykha√Ølo Podoliak a, lui aussi, affirm√© que cette offensive surprise √©tait une cons√©quence de "l'agression" russe en Ukraine, sans pour autant l'attribuer clairement aux forces de Kiev. "D√©sormais, une grande partie de la communaut√© internationale consid√®re la Russie comme une cible l√©gitime pour les op√©rations de n'importe quel type et avec n'importe quelle arme", a-t-il ajout√©, alors que de nombreux pays occidentaux ont interdit √† l'Ukraine d'utiliser les armes qu'ils lui fournissent pour frapper le territoire russe. The root cause of any escalation, shelling, military actions, forced evacuations, and destruction of normal life forms, including within Rf‚Äôs own territories like #Kursk and Belgorod regions, is solely Russia‚Äôs unequivocal aggression. This includes attempts to seize foreign‚Ä¶‚Äî –ú–∏—Ö–∞–π–ª–æ –ü–æ–¥–æ–ª—è–∫ (@Podolyak_M) August 8, 2024Les Etats-Unis, principal soutien de Kiev, ont r√©p√©t√© jeudi "soutenir fermement les efforts de l'Ukraine pour se d√©fendre contre l'agression russe", sans commenter les d√©tails de la situation. La veille, Washington avait pr√©cis√© avoir interrog√© les autorit√©s ukrainiennes pour comprendre les "objectifs" de cette incursion d'une ampleur sans pr√©c√©dent.

author: @httweets
title: Fresh attempt to rejuvenate Naini Lake: MCD invites bids to beautify Model Town attraction | Latest News Delhi - Hindustan Times
text: Fresh attempt to rejuvenate Naini Lake: MCD invites bids to beautify Model Town attraction Under the project, MCD will lay pipelines to ferry wastewater from the Coronation Pillar wastewater treatment plant to Model Town. Additionally, the project will also help provide irrigation water for parks in the vicinity New Delhi In a renewed push to rejuvenate the Naini Lake located in Model Town, north Delhi, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) invited bids to execute the ‚Çπ10.7-crore lake redevelopment project, senior municipal officials said on Thursday. This is the third attempt to rejuvenate the lake. Under the project, MCD will lay pipelines to ferry wastewater from the Coronation Pillar wastewater treatment plant to Model Town. Additionally, the project will also help provide irrigation water for parks in the vicinity and reduce groundwater dependence, officials said. A senior MCD official said a notice inviting tenders for the project was reissued on June 19 and the technical bids were opened on Thursday. ‚ÄúThe project involves laying down pipelines and associated arrangement of carrying treated water from STP, Coronation Pillar, Mukherjee Nagar to Naini Lake by developing pump house and sump wells. This component along is likely to cost around ‚Çπ5.46 crore,‚Äù the official said. The lake is located amid Model Town, across 6.5 acres, and is a popular spot for leisurely strolls and family outings. MCD‚Äôs two previous attempts to rejuvenate the lake failed due to technical and procedural issues. Officials said another ‚Çπ71 lakh will be spent on subsequent arrangements to provide irrigation water from the lake to nearby parks. The project is being funded by the Central government‚Äôs Amrit Sarovar Mission. On June 12, HT reported that more than a third of 21 waterbodies taken up by the civic body under this project remained stuck and work at several sites was yet to be launched. On June 22, MCD announced that it will rejuvenate 21 ponds and waterbodies across the city under the first phase of the Amrit Sarovar Mission. The rejuvenation and beautification work of these waterbodies was to be completed by March 31, 2023, and Naini Lake was one of nine sites where the project was pending. A second senior MCD official said the lake is currently fed by groundwater drawn from borewells. ‚ÄúIdeally, a lake should be recharging the groundwater levels. In case of Naini Lake, we operate pumps to feed the lake. The use of treated wastewater will help the entire region,‚Äù the official said. Musical fountain and beautification The civic body will also undertake beautification of the lake area by adding 7,000 new species of plants, new walkways, designer boundary walls, benches and basic infrastructure, such as a peripheral stormwater drain, officials said. According to the fresh bids, the project work includes the construction of a boundary wall, renovation of the toilet block and addition of benches. ‚ÄúWe will be strengthening the existing peripheral stormwater drain along the lake by providing RCC drain. Around ‚Çπ26 lakh will be spent on provision of lighting arrangement in the lake and horticulture work,‚Äù the second official said. The civic body will also develop two floating fountains in the lake at a cost of ‚Çπ39 lakh component. ‚ÄúThe private company executing the work will also be undertaking operation and maintenance of the lake,‚Äù the official said. author: Daniela Salgado
title: Hasta contenedores en el mar: registros muestran afectaci√≥n por lluvias y viento en regi√≥n del B√≠o B√≠o | Nacional | BioBioChile
text:
Calles anegadas, desprendimiento de techumbres, crecidas de r√≠os y ca√≠da de √°rboles son algunos de los efectos del sistema frontal en la regi√≥n del B√≠o B√≠o .
Debido a esta situaci√≥n, la regi√≥n en su totalidad est√° con Alerta Roja y de acuerdo a lo informado por Senapred, la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa es moderada en el valle longitudinal y precordillera; y alta en el litoral y cordillera de la costa. Lee tambi√©n... Senapred declara Alerta Roja para toda la regi√≥n del B√≠o B√≠o por intensas precipitaciones Jueves 01 Agosto, 2024 | 14:03
Auditores han compartido a La Radio m√∫ltiples registros que muestran la afectaci√≥n , en su mayor√≠a por las rachas de viento registradas en las √∫ltimas horas. Ca√≠da de √°rboles
El viento arras√≥ con todo a su paso esta ma√±ana, resultando afectadas viviendas, pero tambi√©n han generado cortes de camino, como lo ocurrido en la Ruta de la Madera, donde se suspendi√≥ el tr√°nsito vehicular. En tanto, en la ruta que conecta Lebu y Arauco personal de Vialidad debi√≥ realizar despejes por arbustos que estaban bloqueando el sector.
Cedida
En San Pedro de la Paz, en el sector de Portal San Pedro, un √°rbol estuvo a escasos metros de alcanzar a un peat√≥n.
En Villa Ilusi√≥n, una vivienda result√≥ con graves da√±os tras la ca√≠da de un √°rbol. Cedida
Carabineros de la Subcomisar√≠a Los Cerros tambi√©n debi√≥ prestar auxilio a adultos mayores que se vieron afectados por el desprendimiento de un cerro en el techo de sus domicilios. La situaci√≥n ocurri√≥ en el Cerro Corneu. #Talcahuano : En el sector del Cerro Corneu Carabineros de la Subcomisar√≠a Los Cerros auxilian a adultos mayores que fueron v√≠ctimas del desprendimiento de un elemento contundente que impact√≥ en el techo de sus domicilios. Se trabaja junto a la Municipalidad para brindarles apoyo. pic.twitter.com\/FKmbRlfjxu
‚Äî Carabineros Regi√≥n del B√≠o B√≠o (@CarabBioBio) August 1, 2024
El viento puso en riesgo las embarcaciones en el Muelle Blanco, ex Asipes en Talcahuano.
Desprendimiento de techumbres
El desprendimiento de techumbres no s√≥lo afect√≥ a viviendas, sino tambi√©n a empresas y recintos educacionales y comerciales.
A modo de ejemplo est√° lo que ocurri√≥ en el taller 38 de Asmar, en la f√°brica de Helados T√∫ y Yo, y Escuela M√©xico en Talcahuano:
Contenedores al mar
El viento fue de tal intensidad que siete contenedores vac√≠os del Puerto Coronel cayeron al mar. El teniente segundo litoral, Jos√© Manuel Vargas, de la Capitan√≠a de Puerto de la citada comuna, inform√≥ que cuatro de ellos vararon en la playa y tres est√°n avanzando en direcci√≥n a Caleta El Morro. Cedida a RBB Reportan contenedores flotando frente al Puerto de #Coronel en la Regi√≥n del Biob√≠o, autoridades monitorean la compleja situaci√≥n en la Regi√≥n por el sistema frontal que afecta a la Zona @biobio @chile_accidente @Louisvasquez23 @Pabl0Manzanares @Sepulinares pic.twitter.com\/B7PJYPmw5n
‚Äî IEC-180 CONTROL STGO (@fdo2000) August 1, 2024
Calles anegadas
Calles totalmente anegadas en Lomas de San Sebasti√°n, frente al Colegio Almondale en Concepci√≥n.
Tal como ocurre cada vez que llueve, el paso bajo nivel en la rotonda Bonilla en Camilo Henr√≠quez est√° pr√≥ximo a colapsar. Cedida a RBB
Es preciso indicar que las precipitaciones se mantendr√°n hasta el lunes, pero con menor intensidad a la registrada esta jornada.
